Detailed Description

This file contains the function prototypes for the device abstraction layer for Keystone SPI. It also contains some related macro definitions.

Function Documentation

void SPIClockModeSetup ( uint32_t  baseAdd,
uint32_t  df_sel,
uint32_t  clockMode 
)

This call will setup clock polarity and phase in SPIFMTn register of the SPI peripheral.

Parameters
baseAddMemory address of the SPI instance used.
df_selSPI data format register selection.
clockModeSPI clock polarity and phase.
Returns
none.

void SPIData1Setup ( uint32_t  baseAdd,
uint32_t  delay_enable,
uint32_t  cs 
)

This call will setup the SPIData1 register of the SPI peripheral.

Parameters
baseAddMemory address of the SPI instance used.
delay_enableEnable the delay counter at the end of the current transaction.
csChip select number.
Returns
none.
void SPIDataFormatSetup ( uint32_t  baseAdd,
uint32_t  df_sel,
uint32_t  inputClkFreq,
uint32_t  spiOutClk,
uint32_t  clockMode,
uint32_t  charLen 
)

This call will setup the SPIFMTn register of the SPI peripheral.

Parameters
baseAddMemory address of the SPI instance used.
df_selSPI data format register selection.
spiInClkClock frequency given to the SPI module.
spiOutClkClock frequency on the SPI bus.
shiftDirBit shift direction, 0: MSB first, 1: LSB first.
clockModeSPI clock polarity and phase.
charLenSPI data word length in bits.
Returns
none.

uint32_t  df_sel,

df_selSPI data format register selection.

void SPIDelaySetup ( uint32_t  baseAdd,
uint32_t  c2tDelay,
uint32_t  t2cDelay 
)

This call will setup the chip select delays of the SPI peripheral.

Parameters
baseAddMemory address of the SPI instance used.
c2tDelayChip-select-active-to-transmit-start delay.
t2cDelayTransmit-end-to-chip-select-inactive delay.
Returns
none.
void SPIGlobalControlSetup ( uint32_t  baseAdd,
uint32_t  loopback,
uint32_t  powerdown,
uint32_t  clk_master 
)

This call will setup the SPIGCR1 register of the SPI peripheral.

Parameters
baseAddMemory address of the SPI instance used.
loopbackLoop back configuration.
powerdownPower down control.
clk_masterclk mode, master mode.. 
    'loopback' can take the following values.\n
    SPI_LOOPBACK_ON  - Internal loop-back test mode enabled.
    SPI_LOOPBACK_OFF - Internal loop-back test mode disabled.

    'powerdown' can take the following values.\n
    SPI_POWERDOWN_ON  - The SPI is in power-down mode.\n
    SPI_POWERDOWN_OFF - The SPI is in active mode.\n

    'clk_master' can take the following values.\n
    SPI_MASTER_MODE - MASTER MODE. SPICLK is an output and the SPI initiates transfers.\n
    SPI_SLAVE_MODE  - SLAVE MODE. SPICLK is an input and the SPI is an slave.\n
Returns
none.
void SPIIntDisable ( uint32_t  baseAdd,
uint32_t  intFlags 
)

This API will disable the SPI Interrupts.

Parameters
baseAddMemory Address of the SPI instance used.
intFlagsRepresents the various interrupts to be disabled. 
    'intFlags' can take the following values.\n
    SPI_INT_TX_EMPTY    - Transmitter empty \n
    SPI_INT_RX_FULL     - Receiver full\n
    SPI_INT_TX_OVERRUN  - Receiver buffer overrun \n
    SPI_INT_BITERR      - Bit error \n
Returns
none.
Note
Please ensure the proper channel number is passed while using the macros.
void SPIIntEnable ( uint32_t  baseAdd,
uint32_t  intFlags 
)

This API will enable the SPI Interrupts.

Parameters
baseAddMemory Address of the SPI instance used.
intFlagsRepresents the various interrupts to be enabled.
csNumChip select number of the SPI instance used.
    'intFlags' can take the following values.\n
    SPI_INT_TX_EMPTY    - Transmitter empty \n
    SPI_INT_RX_FULL     - Receiver full\n
    SPI_INT_TX_OVERRUN  - Receiver buffer overrun \n
    SPI_INT_BITERR      - Bit error \n
Returns
none.
Note
Please ensure the proper channel number is passed while using the macros.

This API will initialize SPI interrupt configuration.

Parameters
baseAddMemory Address of the SPI instance used.
Returns
none.
void SPIIntInit2 ( uint32_t  baseAdd,
uint32_t  intrLine 
)

This API will initialize SPI interrupt configuration.

This API provides the additonal paramter for interrupt level configuration

Parameters
baseAddMemory Address of the SPI instance used.
intrLineInterupt line configuration SPI_INT_LINE_INT0 - Interrupt line configured to INT0 SPI_INT_LINE_INT1 - Interrupt line configured to INT1
Returns
none.
void SPIIntStatusClear ( uint32_t  baseAdd,
uint32_t  intFlags 
)

This API will clear the status of SPI Interrupts.

Parameters
baseAddMemory Address of the SPI instance used.
intFlagsRepresents the various interrupts to be cleared.
Returns
none.
Note
Please ensure the proper channel number is used while passing the macros passed.
uint32_t SPIIntStatusGet ( uint32_t  baseAdd)

This API will return the status of the SPI peripheral interrupts.

Parameters
baseAddMemory Address of the SPI instance used.
Returns
This API will return the status of the SPI peripheral interrupts. User can use the following macros to check the status
SPI_INT_TX_EMPTY - Transmitter empty
SPI_INT_RX_FULL - Receiver full
SPI_INT_TX_OVERRUN - Receiver buffer overrun
SPI_INT_BITERR - Bit error

Returns

void SPISetShiftDir ( uint32_t  baseAdd,
uint32_t  shift_dir 
)

This call will setup the chip select delays of the SPI peripheral.

Parameters
baseAddMemory address of the SPI instance used.
shift_dirBit shift direction (0: MSB shifted out first, 1: LSB first).
t2cDelayTransmit-end-to-chip-select-inactive delay.
Returns
none.
void SPITransmitData ( uint32_t  baseAdd,
uint32_t  csHold,
uint32_t  txData 
)

This API will put the data on to the SPIDAT1 transmit register.

Parameters
baseAddMemory Address of the SPI instance used.
csHoldChip Select hold mode.
txData32 bit data sent by the user which is put on to the SPIDAT1 register.
Returns
none.

Returns
